name: Troubleshooting Methodologies
description: Flashcards explaining structured methods to identify and resolve technical issues in cloud support environments.

cards.front: You're addressing a slow upload issue in a file-sharing app. You start by checking the user's network and hardware. Which troubleshooting approach are you using?
cards.back: The **Bottom-Up Method**, which begins at the lowest infrastructure levels (network, device) and works up through the stack to the application.
cards.example: A customer experiences slow uploads. You first check their router speed and bandwidth before inspecting server performance.
cards.mnemonic: Start from the Bottom, Build Up
cards.subject: Troubleshooting Methodologies
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: A troubleshooting strategy that starts at the lowest system layers (network, hardware) and progresses upward to applications.

cards.front: You're troubleshooting an intermittent web app outage by checking both server and client components separately. What method are you using?
cards.back: You're applying the **Divide and Conquer Method**, where the problem space is split into smaller parts like server-side and client-side for targeted investigation.
cards.example: You examine server logs and browser behavior separately to isolate the cause of app downtime.
cards.subject: Troubleshooting Methodologies
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: A problem-solving method that breaks issues into smaller domains to isolate and resolve root causes efficiently.

cards.front: A customer reports their app is slow. You ask repeatedly 'why' to trace the issue to unoptimized database indexing. What method are you using?
cards.back: This is the **Five Whys Method**, which helps identify the root cause of an issue through recursive questioning.
cards.example: You trace high response time to slow queries, which are caused by outdated schema design and lack of indexing.
cards.subject: Troubleshooting Methodologies
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: A root cause analysis method involving asking 'why' multiple times to reach the underlying problem.

cards.front: You begin your investigation of email delivery delays by checking service logs and overall email system behavior. Which approach are you using?
cards.back: The **Top-Down Method**, which starts at the highest system level and works downward through service layers and components.
cards.example: You examine the email service status, then drill into delivery routes and recipient mail servers.
cards.subject: Troubleshooting Methodologies
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: A troubleshooting strategy that begins with system-level behavior and narrows down to specific components or causes.
